{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3467844,"name":"Murilo Miranda Santos","username":"murilo404","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/49beb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-03T20:25:25.139Z","cooked":"

Good afternoon everyone! My FRC team has some questions about the PID configuration on a Swerve MK4i. Could someone help us with what numbers should be set? Thanks in advance for your help.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":2,"updated_at":"2025-01-03T20:25:25.139Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":45,"reads":60,"readers_count":59,"score":237.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":478117,"topic_slug":"swerve-pid-configuration","display_username":"Murilo Miranda Santos","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69705,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-pid-configuration/478117/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3467896,"name":"Alex","username":"aopalka","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/f9ae1b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-03T20:57:17.325Z","cooked":"

It will depend on what motor types you are using.

For angles :
Falcon/Kraken ( kP = 100, kI = 0, kD = 0)
Neo/Vortex ( kP = 0.01, kI = 0, kD = 0)

For Drive :
Falcon/Kraken/Neo/Vortex ( kP = 0.05, kI = 0, kD = 0,kF = 0.00)

These are an starting point and should be plugged in initially then fine tuned.

Here is an helpful video no how to tune , it wont match your case exactly ( software he is using and module hardware ) but apply the concepts spoken of to your setup :
